TopicTitle: [PLUGIN 0.15+] Frame Rate Command Pod v1.2: Ap/Pe/Encounter Readouts!

Articles.Content:
[table][tr][td]

[/td]

[td]Well, this plugin (initially being a simple FPS-measuring debug tool) gradually develops into a piloting instrument, which greatly reduces the need in switching back and forth between vessel view and orbital map screen .

In v1.2, it displays the following readings:

  • Frame rate,
  • Current altitude above the terrain (or the reference ellipsoid, if no terrain data is currently available),
  • Apoapsis and periapasis altitude, and time of arrival (for orbiting vessels only),
  • Next encountered celestial body name, and time of arrival (if there's a SOI switch ahead),
  • Distance and direction to nearest Rock Arch or Munolith (press <F7> to toggle).

Warning! No part is included! After installing addon (either extract fpsPod12/ directory's contents into KSP/ folder, or use Generic Mod Enabler), you'll need to open your favorite command pod's PART.CFG file with Notepad and change the module name:

module = fpsPod

All the vessels with this command pod will display its readouts in the upper right corner of the screen.

Plugin requires KSP Version 0.15 or higher!

Download 10 Kb (must be logged in)[/td][/tr][/table]

[table][tr][td]

v1.2:

[/td][td]Added Ap, Pe and next encounter readouts (incl. ETA). Directories made GME-compatible. Requires KSP v0.15+.[/td][/tr]

[tr][td]

v1.1:

[/td][td]Displays altitude above Mun and Minmus correctly. Added Munolith detector. The last KSP v0.14-compatible version.[/td][/tr]

[tr][td]

v1.0:

[/td][td]Initial release.[/td][/tr][/table]

Edited August 6, 2012 by Tosh

Is it possible to have multiple command module names? Like I also use the comsat mod and for any part to be considered a comsat I have to have comsat in the module name.
No, you can only have one of these. That\'s why they introduced the part module system almost nobody is using.

Is it possible to have multiple command module names? Like I also use the comsat mod and for any part to be considered a comsat I have to have comsat in the module name.

As far as i know the comsat plugin works with vessels that have 'comsat' in the *vessel name* - not in the part or module name.
Well, you need either the comsat pod or the comms antenna to relay on the network.

Well, you need either the comsat pod or the comms antenna to relay on the network.

Ah! Good catch, thank you!
